contentrichtext.text: '''Jerry Hunt''' (November 30, 1943 in [[Waco, Texas]] - November 27, 1993 in [[Canton, Texas]]) was an [[United States|American]] [[composer]] who created works using live [[electronic music|electronics]] partly controlled by his [[ritual]]istic performance techniques, influenced by his interest in the [[occult]]. He committed [[suicide]] in response to terminal [[cancer]]. He used [[carbon monoxide]]. His collaborators included [[Karen Finley]], [[Mike Patton]], [[Paul Panhuysen]], and [[Philip Krumm]]. Hunt was also the founder of [[IRIDA Records]], which released recordings with works by [[Larry Austin]], [[James Fulkerson]], [[Dary John Mizelle]], [[Rodney Waschka II]], and others, as well as recordings of his own music.<ref>[http://www.deeplistening.org/dlc/95irida.html The Deep Listening Catalog - IRIDA RECORDS<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> ==Partial discography== "Other Places", Lois Svard, piano. New York: Lovely Music Ltd. (CD 3052) 1997.<ref>[http://www.lovely.com/ • Lovely Music •<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> *Trapani (stream) "Jerry Hunt: Lattice". New York: New World Records, 2007. (Rerelease of CRI recording from 1996 which was a rerelease of the IRIDA recording listed below from 1979, with the addition of "Lattice".) <ref>[http://www.newworldrecords.org/album.cgi?rm=view&album_id=1749 New World Records: Music Search<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.jerryhunt.org/recworks.htm Jerry Hunt: recorded works<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> *Lattice *Transform (Stream) *Cantegral Segment 18. 17 *Transphalba, *Volta (Kernel) "Jerry Hunt" works by Hunt, performed by Hunt. Canton, Texas: Irida 0032, 1979. *Transform (Stream) *Cantegral Segment 18. 17 *Transphalba, *Volta (Kernel) "The Aerial, Volume 1". Santa Fe, New Mexico: Nonsequitur Foundation, 1990.<ref>[http://nseq.blogspot.com/1990_02_01_nseq_archive.html nonsequitur: February 1990<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> *Babylon (string) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *http://www4.ncsu.edu/~waschka/hunt.html *[http://www.oodiscs.com/oo9.html oodiscs #9: Jerry Hunt - Ground: Five Mechanic Convention Streams] *[http://www.jerryhunt.org The Jerry Hunt Home Page] {{Authority control|VIAF=19931204}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Hunt, Jerry | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = November 30, 1943 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = November 27, 1993 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hunt, Jerry}} [[Category:1943 births]] [[Category:1993 deaths]] [[Category:20th-century classical composers]] [[Category:American composers]] [[Category:American electronic musicians]] [[Category:University of North Texas College of Music alumni]] [[Category:Composers who committed suicide]] [[Category:LGBT composers]] [[Category:LGBT musicians from the United States]] [[Category:Texas classical music]] [[Category:Sound artists]] [[Category:Suicides in Texas]] [[Category:Tzadik Records artists]]
